Detailed Description

Section 5.3.3.1. Represents the postion and state of one entity in the world. COMPLETE

Copyright (c) 2007-2009, MOVES Institute, Naval Postgraduate School. All rights reserved.

Author:
DMcG, jkg

std::vector<ArticulationParameter> DIS::EntityStatePdu::_articulationParameters [protected]

int DIS::EntityStatePdu::_capabilities [protected]

a series of bit flags

DeadReckoningParameter DIS::EntityStatePdu::_deadReckoningParameters [protected]

parameters used for dead reckoning

int DIS::EntityStatePdu::_entityAppearance [protected]

a series of bit flags that are used to help draw the entity, such as smoking, on fire, etc.

EntityID DIS::EntityStatePdu::_entityID [protected]

Unique ID for an entity that is tied to this state information

Vector3Float DIS::EntityStatePdu::_entityLinearVelocity [protected]

Describes the speed of the entity in the world

Vector3Double DIS::EntityStatePdu::_entityLocation [protected]

describes the location of the entity in the world

Orientation DIS::EntityStatePdu::_entityOrientation [protected]

describes the orientation of the entity, in euler angles

EntityType DIS::EntityStatePdu::_entityType [protected]

Describes the type of entity in the world

unsigned char DIS::EntityStatePdu::_forceId [protected]

What force this entity is affiliated with, eg red, blue, neutral, etc

Marking DIS::EntityStatePdu::_marking [protected]

characters that can be used for debugging, or to draw unique strings on the side of entities in the world

char DIS::EntityStatePdu::_numberOfArticulationParameters [protected]

How many articulation parameters are in the variable length list
